citeinfo.title: Seasonal Mesoplankton Biomass Variations in the Surface Layer of the Bering Sea and the Northwest Pacific

descript.abstract: Statistical analysis of 1950-1953 data on the biomass of mesoplankton shows biomass variations over the range 770 Mg/m super(3) in summer to 74 mg/m super(3) in winter with an annual average of 240 mg/m super(3). These values are in good agreement with seasonal variations observed at ocean weather station "P" in the Northeast Pacific (50 degree N, 145 degree W) over the period of 1954-1964.
descript.purpose: to report the seasonal mesoplankton biomass variations in the surface layer of the Bering Sea and the Northwest Pacific.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
